security_audit.summary: Pure documentation skill containing markdown documentation for Next.js patterns. No executable code, network calls, or file system access. The static analyzer flagged JSON string patterns as cryptographic/network threats, but these are metadata fields in a configuration file. This skill only provides guidance documentation.

content.value_statement: Get best practices for Next.js 15 App Router including Server Components, layouts, and navigation patterns. Build modern React applications with proper architecture.
actual_capabilities: Guide on App Router page structure and component placement
Explain Server vs Client Component decisions
Show proper navigation patterns with Link and useRouter
Demonstrate data fetching in Server Components
Provide metadata and SEO configuration examples
limitations: Contains project-specific patterns not generic Next.js documentation
Does not include code execution or file generation capabilities
Requires existing Next.js project to apply patterns

output_examples.input: How do I create a new dashboard page?
output: Export default function as Server Component by default
Use use client directive only for state or effects
Add Link components for internal navigation

output_examples.input: When should I use Server Components vs Client Components?
output: Use Server Components by default for better performance
Use Client Components when you need useState or useEffect
Use Client Components for event handlers and browser APIs
Keep client-side logic in separate components

best_practices: Default to Server Components for better performance and security
Use Link from next/link for all internal navigation links
Keep client-side logic in separate components with use client directive
Define metadata at page or layout level for SEO optimization
anti_patterns: Avoid using useRouter when Link component would suffice
Do not make all components Client Components unnecessarily
Avoid fetching data in Client Components when Server Components can handle it

faq.question: What versions of Next.js support App Router?
faq.answer: Next.js 13 and later versions support the App Router. This skill focuses on Next.js 15 patterns.

faq.question: What is the maximum number of nested routes supported?
faq.answer: Next.js supports deep nesting. Practical limits depend on project complexity and file organization.

faq.question: How do I integrate this with existing projects?
faq.answer: Apply patterns to new routes in app directory. App Router can coexist with pages directory.

faq.question: Does this skill access any external data?
faq.answer: No. This skill only provides documentation. No data is read, written, or transmitted.

faq.question: Why is my page not updating with navigation?
faq.answer: Ensure you are using Link for navigation. Client Components using useRouter must be wrapped properly.

faq.question: How does this compare to the pages router?
faq.answer: App Router offers Server Components by default, nested layouts, and streaming. Pages router is still supported.
